firstPageTitle: SOL Collaborative planning | percentage alignment to collaborative planning filtered for high-need students
secondPageTitle: Weekly report initiative 2 | Collaborative planning with high-need students

insights.title: [THIS IS PLACEHOLDER CONTENT]
insights.content: Consultants frequently missed opportunities to deeply explore and align students’ career aspirations with their educational choices. For instance, a student expressed interest in becoming a Deputy Director (Segment 52, Call ID: 565421068435), but the consultant didn’t fully explore how the Master’s program could support this. Similarly, a student’s interest in AI for medicine (Segment 27, Call ID: 590473617210) was not further explored to create a tailored educational plan.

insights.title: [THIS IS PLACEHOLDER CONTENT]
insights.content: Students frequently expressed concerns about balancing studies with work and personal commitments, which were often not adequately addressed. For instance, a student voiced worry about managing studies alongside family responsibilities and a new job (call 590712471724, segment 61). Similarly, a student mentioned being a shift worker, which presented a perfect opportunity to discuss flexible study options (call 565421068435, segment 24). These missed opportunities could have significantly enhanced students’ confidence in their ability to succeed in the program.

insights.title: [THIS IS PLACEHOLDER CONTENT]
insights.content: Develop a structured framework for aligning educational pathways with students’ career goals. For example, when a student mentions a career goal like becoming a Deputy Director, consultants should explore how the Master’s program can support this goal.
